heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 03 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (179°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 616 m) and light levels (up 4510 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4857 lux) and cloud levels (up 621 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 616.5m lower than yesterday, 370.8m lower than the past week, 621.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 901m and a high of 2830m, averaging 1010.2m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and bright intervals likely. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (89%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
